topic.title: Submissions
topic.section:
Submission Process. Requirements can be specified for submissions to a scheduled conference: whether abstracts or proposals or both are required, whether single presentation or multiple presentations are required, whether supplemetary files are required together with abstracts and proposals, and whether an acknowledgement email should be sent to conference primary contact as well as submitters.

Call for Papers and Author Guidelines. In additon to a call for papers message, author guidelines followed by a set of checklist items, which must be checked by the author before submission, are provided to ensure standardization in formatting.

Submission Indexing and Identification of Conference Content. For prospective well access to research resources, categories for indexing can be selected, accompanied by examples provided by the Conference Manager, for authors to index their own submissions. An identification system such as DOIs can also be used to uniquely identify presentations and/or supplementary files.
